text: Which HTTP messages have an empty body?
choice1: A GET response message with a status code of 200 (OK) delivers the requested information (e.g., a HTML document) in its message body.
choice2: A POST request message needs a message body for transporting any information such as (form submission) parameter values or a message payload.
choice3: A GET request message may transmit queryÂ parameter values encoded as part of the path, but it does not use a message body.
choice4: A POST response message transmits the confirmation or error message in its message body.

text: The Prolog of an XML document is optional. It may include the following:
choice3: A document type declaration such as <!DOCTYPE langlist SYSTEM langlist.dtd>
